<!-- DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE DIRECTLY.
THIS FILE IS GENERATED from https://github.com/temporalio/documentation-samples-python/blob/develop-patching/your_cron_job/your_cron_dacx.py. -->

You can set each Workflow to repeat on a schedule with the `cron_schedule` option from either the [`start_workflow()`](https://python.temporal.io/temporalio.client.Client.html#start_workflow) or [`execute_workflow()`](https://python.temporal.io/temporalio.client.Client.html#execute_workflow) asynchronous methods.

<div class="copycode-notice-container"><div class="copycode-notice"><img data-style="copycode-icon" src="/icons/copycode.png" alt="Copy code icon" /> Sample application code information <img id="i-5b374514-23a3-44d3-9778-304ee219d84a" data-event="clickable-copycode-info" data-style="chevron-icon" src="/icons/chevron.png" alt="Chevron icon" /></div><div id="copycode-info-5b374514-23a3-44d3-9778-304ee219d84a" class="copycode-info">The following code sample comes from a working and tested sample application. The code sample might be abridged within the guide to highlight key aspects. Visit the source repository to <a href="https://github.com/temporalio/documentation-samples-python/blob/develop-patching/your_cron_job/your_cron_dacx.py">view the source code</a> in the context of the rest of the application code.</div></div>

```python

# ...
    result = await client.execute_workflow(
        CronWorkflow.run,
        id="your-workflow-id",
        task_queue="your-task-queue",
        cron_schedule="* * * * *",
    )
    print(f"Results: {result}")
```
